document_api_meta.title: Search Seller Affiliate Orders
document_api_meta.env_desc: This API allows the partner to retrieve a list of affiliate orders (orders which are affiliate-commission eligible) generated by a seller, returning the order ID and the product ID. Using this, the partner can track their affiliate-conversions on behalf of a seller, using the order ID.

request_header_param.name: x-tts-access-token
request_header_param.desc: The seller access_token value from [Get Access Token](https://partner.tiktokshop.com/docv2/page/678e3a3292b0f40314a92d75#Get%20Access%20Token%20API), when user_type = 0. Follow this [guide](https://partner.tiktokshop.com/docv2/page/678e3a344ddec3030b238fa0) to get seller access_token.

request_query_param.name: app_key
request_query_param.desc: Every single app will have a unique key. Please use the specific key assigned to your app.

request_query_param.name: sign
request_query_param.desc: Signature generated by gen algorithm. When you send API requests to TTS, you must sign them so that TTS can identify the senders.

request_query_param.name: timestamp
request_query_param.desc: Unix timestamp GMT (UTC+00:00). This timestamp is used across all API requests. Developers can use this convert to local time.

request_query_param.name: page_token
request_query_param.desc: An opaque token used to retrieve the next page of a paginated result set. Retrieve this value from the result of the `next_page_token` from a previous response. It is not needed for the first page.

request_query_param.name: page_size
request_query_param.desc:
The number of results to be returned per page. Default: 20
Valid Range: [1-100]

request_query_param.name: shop_cipher
request_query_param.desc:
Use this property to pass shop information in requesting the API. Failure in passing the correct value when requesting the API for cross-border shops will return incorrect response. 
Get by API [Get Authorization Shop](https://partner.tiktokshop.com/docv2/page/6507ead7b99d5302be949ba9?external_id=6507ead7b99d5302be949ba9)

request_query_param.name: category_asset_cipher
request_query_param.desc: The partner identifier used in API requests. Retrieve this value by using the [Get Authorized Category Assets API] (https://partner.tiktokshop.com/docv2/page/666012dd609d4402cc3be995).

request_body_param.name: create_time_lt
request_body_param.desc:
Filter orders to show only those that are created before the specified date and time. Unix timestamp.
Refer to notes in `create_time_ge` for more usage information.

request_body_param.name: create_time_ge
request_body_param.desc:
Filter orders to show only those that are created on or after the specified date and time. Unix timestamp.

Note:
`create_time_ge` and `create_time_lt` together constitute the creation time filter condition.
- If `create_time_ge` is filled but `create_time_lt` is empty, `create_time_lt` will default to the current time.
- If `create_time_lt` is filled but `create_time_ge` is empty, `create_time_ge` will default to the earliest shop time.

request_body_param.name: program_id
request_body_param.desc: Filter orders by the associated affiliate program. This can be a campaign ID, target collaboration ID, or open collaboration ID.

response_param.name: code
response_param.desc: The success or failure status code returned in API response.

response_param.name: message
response_param.desc: The success or failure messages returned in API response. Reasons of failure will be described in the message.

response_param.name: request_id
response_param.desc: Request log

response_param.name: data
response_param.desc: Specific return information

response_param.name: ^orders
response_param.desc: The returned list of orders.

response_param.name: ^^id
response_param.desc: The order ID.

response_param.name: ^^delivery_time
response_param.desc: The date and time when the order was delivered. Unix timestamp.

response_param.name: ^^create_time
response_param.desc: The date and time when the order was created. Unix timestamp.

response_param.name: ^^status
response_param.desc:
The order status. This is an enumerated type with values:
* ALL 
* PROCESSING 
* COMPLETED 
* CANCELLED 
* FROZEN 
* DEDUCTED

response_param.name: ^^skus
response_param.desc: The list of SKUs that are included in this order.

response_param.name: ^^^open_collaboration_id
response_param.desc: The ID of the open collaboration in which the product is enrolled.

response_param.name: ^^^target_collaboration_id
response_param.desc: The ID of the target collaboration in which the product is enrolled.

response_param.name: ^^^campaign_id
response_param.desc: The ID of the TAP campaign in which the product is enrolled.

response_param.name: ^^^creator_username
response_param.desc: The username of the creator that's participating in the specified open collaboration.

response_param.name: ^^^price
response_param.desc: The SKU selling price information.

response_param.name: ^^^^amount
response_param.desc: The price amount.

response_param.name: ^^^^currency
response_param.desc: The price currency.

response_param.name: ^^^quantity
response_param.desc: The SKU quantity for the order.

response_param.name: ^^^content_type
response_param.desc:
The content format of the creator content through which the order was created.
Possible values:
- SHOP
- VIDEO
- LIVE
- PRE_LIVE
- PROMOTION_PAGE
- LINKSHARE

response_param.name: ^^^content_id
response_param.desc: The content identifier.

response_param.name: ^^^product_id
response_param.desc: The product  ID in TikTok Shop.

response_param.name: ^^^commission_model
response_param.desc:
Determine order commission be calculated based on fixed commission model or tiering
model

response_param.name: ^^^commission_tier_setting
response_param.desc: Between Seller & Creator percentagecommission. When tiering commission model applied, will return each tier's commission rate seller set.

response_param.name: ^^^commission_rate
response_param.desc: The commission rate established by the seller to be paid to creators involved in the collaboration, expressed in hundredths of a percent. For example, 1550 represents a commission rate of 15.50%.

response_param.name: ^^^shop_ads_commission_rate
response_param.desc: The commission rate for orders generated through Shop Ads.

response_param.name: ^^^estimated_commission_base
response_param.desc:
The estimated total sales value before deducting any refunds, used as a base for calculating commission.
Formula: selling price * order quantity

response_param.name: ^^^^amount
response_param.desc: The commission base amount.

response_param.name: ^^^^currency
response_param.desc: The commission base currency.

response_param.name: ^^^estimated_paid_shop_ads_commission
response_param.desc:
The estimated Shop Ads commission that a seller will pay on sales.
Formula: estimated commission base * Shop Ads commission rate

response_param.name: ^^^^amount
response_param.desc: The commission amount.

response_param.name: ^^^^currency
response_param.desc: The commission currency.

response_param.name: ^^^estimated_paid_commission
response_param.desc:
The estimated commission that a seller will pay on sales.
Formula: estimated commission base *  commission rate

response_param.name: ^^^^amount
response_param.desc: The commission amount.

response_param.name: ^^^^currency
response_param.desc: The commission currency.

response_param.name: ^^^actual_commission_base
response_param.desc:
The actual total sales value after deducting any refunds, used as a base for calculating commission.
Formula: selling price * (order quantity - return/refund quantity)

response_param.name: ^^^^amount
response_param.desc: The commission base amount.

response_param.name: ^^^^currency
response_param.desc: The commission base currency.

response_param.name: ^^^actual_paid_commission
response_param.desc:
The actual commission the seller will pay on sales.
Formula: actual commission base * commission rate

response_param.name: ^^^^amount
response_param.desc: The commission amount.

response_param.name: ^^^^currency
response_param.desc: The commission currency.

response_param.name: ^^^actual_paid_shop_ads_commission
response_param.desc:
The actual Shop Ads commission the seller will pay on sales.
Formula: actual commission base * Shop Ads commission rate

response_param.name: ^^^^amount
response_param.desc: The commission amount.

response_param.name: ^^^^currency
response_param.desc: The commission currency.

response_param.name: ^^^refunded_quantity
response_param.desc: The number of SKUs refunded.

response_param.name: ^^^returned_quantity
response_param.desc: The number of SKUs returned.

response_param.name: ^^^estimated_cofunded_creator_bonus_amount
response_param.desc: The portion of the estimated creator bonus that you co-fund in commission boost.

response_param.name: ^^^^amount
response_param.desc: The commission amount.

response_param.name: ^^^^currency
response_param.desc: The commission currency.

response_param.name: ^^^actual_cofunded_creator_bonus_amount
response_param.desc: The portion of the actual creator bonus that you co-fund in commission boost.

response_param.name: ^^^^amount
response_param.desc: The commission amount.

response_param.name: ^^^^currency
response_param.desc: The commission currency.

response_param.name: ^next_page_token
response_param.desc: An opaque token used to retrieve the next page of a paginated result set. Provide this value in the `page_token` parameter of your request if the current response does not return all the results.

response_param.name: ^total_count
response_param.desc: The total number of orders that matches the query conditions.

sample_code.label: Go
sample_code.value:
// For more details about the SDK, refer to the documentation:
// https://partner.tiktokshop.com/docv2/page/67c83e0799a75104986ae498
func affiliateSeller202410SearchSellerAffiliateOrdersPost() {
    configuration := apis.NewConfiguration()
    configuration.AddAppInfo(appKey, appSecret)
    apiClient := apis.NewAPIClient(configuration)
    request := apiClient.AffiliateSellerV202410API.AffiliateSeller202410OrdersSearchPost(context.Background())
    request = request.XTtsAccessToken("your access token")
    request = request.ContentType("application/json")
    request = request.PageToken("b2Zmc2V0PTAK")
    request = request.PageSize(20)
    request = request.ShopCipher("your shop cipher")
    affiliateSeller202410SearchSellerAffiliateOrdersRequestBody := affiliateSeller_v202410.NewAffiliateSeller202410SearchSellerAffiliateOrdersRequestBody()
    affiliateSeller202410SearchSellerAffiliateOrdersRequestBody.SetCreateTimeLt(1722485856)
    affiliateSeller202410SearchSellerAffiliateOrdersRequestBody.SetCreateTimeGe(1719807456)
    affiliateSeller202410SearchSellerAffiliateOrdersRequestBody.SetProgramId("73661290629")
    request = request.AffiliateSeller202410SearchSellerAffiliateOrdersRequestBody(*affiliateSeller202410SearchSellerAffiliateOrdersRequestBody)
    resp, httpResp, err := request.Execute()
    if err != nil || httpResp.StatusCode != 200 {
        fmt.Printf("productsRequest err:%v resbody:%s", err, httpResp.Body)
        return
    }
    if resp == nil {
        fmt.Printf("response is nil")
        return
    }
    if resp.GetCode()!= 0 {
        fmt.Printf("response business is error, errorCode:%d errorMessage:%s", resp.GetCode(), resp.GetMessage())
        return
    }
    respDataJson, _ := json.MarshalIndent(resp.GetData(), "", "  ")
    fmt.Println("response data:", string(respDataJson))
    return
}

sample_code.label: Node.js
Java

scope_list.package_description: The application will be able to access a Seller's overall TikTok Shop Affiliate Collaborations, including but not limited to collaboration details (e.g., activity, applications, descriptions, and performance), creator participation/engagement results, affiliate links, affiliate orders, and sample rules.
scope_list.auth_info: The application will be able to access your TikTok Shop Affiliate Collaborations, including but not limited to collaboration activity and performance, creator participation/engagement results, affiliate links, and affiliate orders.
